subject: Art
title: One-Point Perspective
description: All lines converge to a single vanishing point on the horizon.

hook.text: Stand on train tracks and look into the distance. The rails appear to meet at a single point on the horizon. That point is the vanishing point â€” and it's the foundation of perspective drawing.

buildup.text: One-point perspective: one vanishing point on the horizon line. All depth lines (going away from you) converge to that point. Vertical lines stay vertical. Horizontal lines stay horizontal.

discovery.text: This is perfect for: roads disappearing into distance, hallways, rooms viewed straight-on, and any scene where you're looking directly down the center.

twist.text: The placement of the vanishing point changes everything. Center = calm and balanced. Off-center = more dynamic. Below center = looking up. Above center = looking down.

climax.text: Draw a dot on your paper (vanishing point) and a horizontal line through it (horizon). Now draw a road, buildings, or a room with all depth lines converging to that dot.

punchline.text: One point. Infinite depth. That's perspective.

quiz.question: In one-point perspective, where do all depth lines converge?
options: A single vanishing point on the horizon
